spy.name: Spy
spy.description:
Don't get eliminated.
Pretend you know the secret word.

chaos.name: Chaos
chaos.description:
Get eliminated.
Say unrelated words to get eliminated. But if it's too obious they won't eliminate you.

help.title: Help
help.content:
## Rules

There is a secret word, some players know it (_Normals_) and some don't (_Spys_). _Normals_ have to eliminate _Spys_, and _Spys_ have to pretend to be _Normals_. Sometines there's also _Chaos_, that plays solo and has to be eliminated by looking suspicious.

Every round every player, one by one, says a word related to the secret word. For example, if the word is "Mermaid", players may say: "Water", "Human", "Fish", and "Swim". But in the real game they may say: "Water", "Life", "Ground", "Swim". As you can see, the third word is really souspicious, and the second one could be as well but it's not clear. Probably the players who said those words are _Spys_ or _Chaos_.

Then the players all together discuss who may be a _Spy_, then they optionally vote for who to eliminate, one by one, in the same order they said the word. The eliminated player reveals his role and...:

- If he's a _Spy_, the game continues.
- If he's _Normal_, the _Spys_ win immedeately.
- If he's _Chaos_, the game contunues, but he's also a winner.

If there's a tie, noone is eliminated. After the 2nd round with no eliminated players, the game ends and eveyone reveals his role:

- If there are _Spys_, the _Spys_ win.
- If there are no _Spys_, the _Normals_ win.

If the _Normals_ win, the _Spys_ have a last chance to win, by guessing the secret word. After discussing openly, they have 1 try to guess the secret word. If the word is right, the _Spys_ win, and if it's wrong, the _Normals_ keep the victory.

## Requirements

- Between 5 and 11 players.
- One phone per player.
- Internet connection.

## Setup

1. Every player scans the QR code with the phone to open the game's web app. Or visits the link [https://wordspy.netlify.app](https://wordspy.netlify.app)
1. The players agree on a **Word set**, and all of them select it in their phones.
1. The players agree on a **Round number**, and all of them input it in their phones. There's a button to generate a random number, one player uses it and tells the number to the others.
1. Assign a player number to everyone and every player inputs their unique number in their phones. So a random player is number 1, the one in her left is number 2, the next is number 3, untill everyone has a number.
1. The players agree on the **language** t play in, and all of them select it in their phones. Some words can't be translated and keep all the nuances.
1. Check that everyone has the right values. If someone doesn't, he'll get a wrong word.
1. Every player hides their phone screen and clicks "Let's play!". The word and role will show up.
1. Play!

## Roles

### Normal {'{.color-role-normal}'}
- They know the secret word and have to convince the others they know it, without making the word obious to the _Spys_.
- **Objective**: Eliminate the _Spys_, but not the other _Normals_ or _Chaos_.
- There can be up to 6 _Normals_.

### Spy {'{.color-role-spy}'}
- They don't know the secret word and have to convince the others they know it, by inprovising words.
- **Objective**: Don't get eliminated during the game or eliminate a _Normal_.
- There can be up to 4 _Spys_.

### Chaos {'{.color-role-chaos}'}
- They know the secret word and have to convince the others they don't know it, by looking suspicious.
- **Objective**: Get eliminated.
- There can be up to 1 _Chaos_.
- **Note**: When the objective is completed the game continues, but you're also considered a winner.
